variant.question: Which Q-code is used to report altitude?
Which Q-code is used to report altitude?
QFE is the RTF Q-code to indicate the...

options.text: atmospheric pressure at aerodrome elevation or at runway threshold.
atmospheric pressure corrected to the aircraft cockpit height.
atmospheric pressure referred to the highest fixed obstacle located on the surface of an aerodrome.
altimeter sub-scale setting to obtain the flight level reference datum.

variant.question: QNH is the Q-code to indicate

options.text: the altimeter sub-scale setting to obtain elevation when on the ground.
the atmospheric pressure measured at the aerodrome reference point (ARP).
the atmospheric pressure referred to the highest obstacle located on the surface of an aerodrome.
the atmospheric pressure at aerodrome elevation (or at runway threshold).

variant.question: What is the Q-code for "magnetic bearing from the station"?

What is the Q-code for True bearing to the station?

A pilot on a cross-country flight intends to obtain help from an ATC unit for orientation. Which Q code would he use to indicate “Request a true track to reach you”?
What is the Q-code for magnetic heading to the station (no wind)?
What is the Q-code for Magnetic heading to the station (no wind)?
How do you request the magnetic bearing from a station?
Which of the following Q codes are solely used to communicate directions and bearings in RTF air-ground communications?
You are unsure of the holding procedure at the relevant VOR or NDB. How should you ask ATC for assistance with that?
What Q-code indicates "The true track from the station":
What is the Q-code for 'true bearing from the station'?
What are the Q-codes for magnetic bearing to and from a station?
If you are requested to report your height, to which Q-code-setting would you refer?
If you are requested to report your height, to which Q-code-setting would you refer?
What are the Q codes used to establish altitude and height?
Which Q-code is used to express pressures in RT messages?
An aircraft requests detailed information about a holding procedure. What is the correct sequence and content?

options.text: Name of fix, level (optional), inbound track (optional), direction of turn (optional), time of leg (optional), expected approach clearance time.
Name of fix, level (optional) outbound heading, direction of turn (optional), expected approach clearance time (optional).
Name of navigation aid and radial, distance of leg (optional), altitude (optional), direction of turn (optional), expected landing time.
Name of fix, inbound heading (optional), direction of turn (optional), holding altitude, time of leg (optional), estimated time of arrival, additional instructions.

variant.question: Which Q-code is used to express bearings or directions in RTF messages?

You assume that your navigational instruments might be affected by some erroneous inputs from the receivers. Your intention is to plot true bearings from two stations with VDF facilities to confirm your position. Your request from each station will ask for:
As the pilot of G-ACME, you need to know your true bearing from the aerodrome at Karlsgrab. What message should you transmit to the aerodrome ATS unit?

options.text: Karlsgrab Homer, Golf Alfa Charlie Mike Echo request QTE.
Karlsgrab Homer, Golf Alfa Charlie Mike Echo request QDR.
Karlsgrab Approach, Golf Alfa Charlie Mike Echo request QGH.
Karlsgrab Approach, Golf Alfa Charlie Mike Echo request QDM.

variant.question: You are temporarily unsure of your position and wish to plot your position using true bearings from two nearby airfields equipped with DF (direction finding).  Which is the correct 'Q' code to use?
How do you request your true bearing from BERN airport?

options.text: True bearing, ABC, request true bearing
Approach, ABC, request true bearing, I say again, request true bearing

Normally speaking the letters as a complete word

options.text: Normally speaking using the constituent letters.
Normally speaking the letters as a complete word.

variant.question: To assist a radar controller to identify your aircraft, you are asked for your position. The LUGBERRY VOR station is 5 miles north of you. How do you report your position in relation to it?

options.text: POSITION FIVE MILES SOUTH OF LUGBERRY VOR, G-ACZG
ONE EIGHT ZERO FIVE FROM LUGBERRY VOR, G-ACZG
LUGBERRY VOR FIVE MILES ONE EIGHT ZERO, G-ACZG
POSITION LUGBERRY VOR FIVE MILES NORTH, G-ACZG

variant.question: To assist a radar controller to identify your aircraft, you are asked for your position. The LUGBERRY VOR station is 5 miles north of you. How do you report your position in relation to it?

options.text: POSITION FIVE MILES SOUTH OF LUGBERRY VOR, G-ACZG.
LUGBERRY VOR FIVE MILES ONE EIGHT ZERO, G-ACZG.
POSITION LUGBERRY VOR FIVE MILES NORTH, G-ACZG.
ONE EIGHT ZERO FIVE FROM LUGBERRY VOR, G-ACZG.

variant.question: On the flight deck a successful 'logon procedure' enables...

options.text: a CPDLC connection to be established between an ATS unit and the aircraft.
voice communications to be established between the aircraft and an aeronautical ground station.
activation of the Mode S capability of the aircraft.
radar identification of the aircraft by ATC.

variant.question: What is the proper way to request QFE?

options.text: Normal speaking by using constituent letters.
Pronouncing it as a word or a string of letters, at the discretion of the speaker.

variant.question:
It is 2043 UTCA pilot is fourteen minutes from the next waypoint, CMB, when he/she is asked to give an estimate for CMB
 What is the reply?

options.text: Estimate Charlie Mike Bravo-VOR two zero five seven.
Estimate Charlie Mike Bravo-VOR fifty seven.
Estimate Charlie Mike Bravo-VOR zero eight five seven Papa Mike.
Estimate Charlie Mike Bravo-VOR twenty fifty seven.

variant.question: At 20:43 UTC, a pilot is fourteen minutes from the next waypoint CMB VOR. He is asked to give an estimated time overhead CMB. What would be the correct reply?

options.text: Estimate Charlie Mike Bravo VOR two zero five seven.
Estimate Charlie Mike Bravo VOR zero eight five seven Papa Mike.
Estimate Charlie Mike Bravo VOR twenty fifty-seven.
Estimate Charlie Mike Bravo VOR fifty-seven.

variant.question:
In order to avoid a CB a pilot wants to turn right to a magnetic heading of 100 degrees. 

What is the correct way to ask the ATC unit for permission?

options.text: Request right turn to heading one-point-zero-zero.
Request right turn to heading one-double-0.
Request right turn to heading one-hundred degrees.

variant.question: In order to avoid a CB a pilot wants to turn right to a magnetic heading of 100 degrees. What is the correct way to ask the ATC unit for permission?

options.text: Request right turn to heading one-point-zero-zero.
Request right turn to heading one-double-0.
Request right turn to heading one-hundred degrees.
